page.title: 02HOME LIFE.
page.content: The average family living in Cornish Hall End in 1985 consists of a married couple with 2.2 children.The majority of homes are of older people although there is a steady increase in young families moving into the village. Most houses are brick built with older ones of lathe & plaster with roofs of slate tiles and thatch, the newest house being built in 1982. There are council houses,tied cottages and the remainder privately owned. Mains water, electricity and sewers go into most homes although some have wells and cess pits and outside toilets. 9 out of 10 families keep pets such as a dog,cat and rabbit. Most husbands go out of the village to work while their wives stay at home some doing a part-time job.
